website_summaries.verdict: The design of this bin can fit anywhere, although the rim cracks easily if the lid isn't screwed on properly.
pros: These bins are used by professionals, are stackable, easy to open and close, and keep the smell of contents inside
cons: Rodents can chew through the plastic lid

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not ant proof
customer_reviews.text: We bought this container because we had major ant problems and this container claimed to be ant proof but wasn't the case. A week after buying it we had hundreds of ants get into the food and ruined it all. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brianm805

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!  Do not buy!!!  Defective product!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I thought the rings at the top were breaking because careless people over tightened them. I owe all you fellow victims an apology. I'm 55 with arthritic hands. I also was very conscious of treating my vaults gently with an easy swirl and mine have still cracked. It's like the plastic ring at the top of the vault shrinks. It's been four months and two have cracked. This is stupid. So much for a good deal. Forget these and use a litter pail. Much cheaper and just as effective.
customer_reviews.author: Horsemom

customer_reviews.title: This container is not ant proof.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these containers and was so confident that it would keep ants away from my dogs expensive food. Well, both containers were defective cause somehow the dog food was saturated by millions of ants that found their way inside the containers via the seal. Yes, the lids were closed tight but the ants found their way in....unbelievable. I had to discard two full containers of expensive dog food. I don't recommend this brand of containers.
customer_reviews.author: justforfun

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not as heavy duty as claimed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this "heavy duty" Gamma 2 Vittles Vault Nov 18, 2015 It's been inside of my house the entire time, opening only twice a day from then to now (Feb 25, 2016). No rough handling. My photo will shows how it's coming apart. Loved the idea of it, considering it was gently used and this happened, is there an EXTRA heavy duty option? Update: I contacted Gamma2 Incorporated's customer service via their website regarding my issue and promptly got a response, they priority shipped me a replacement same day. and based on the dealer support vid page, i think some of us may be over tightening this product (my honest opinion atleast) [...]
customer_reviews.author: Roger Silva

customer_reviews.title: Airtight? Not AntTight!
customer_reviews.text: Airtight? It’s most definitely not Ant Tight. Tried silicone, different lid to no avail. Have now wasted 3 bags of dog food at $60/bag. Tried contacting company, no response. Time to seek an alternative product.
customer_reviews.author: sportofkings

customer_reviews.title: Yeah
customer_reviews.text: Finally received a call back. New Pringle’s. Perfect! Hate to leave a bad review but... Have one for 9 years now. It's great no issues. Brought home a new puppy and picked one up for her. O-ring failed in 12 days. I've called and emailed the company and have had no nothing nada response in 10 days. Sad when a good company starts selling cheap inferior products. It's going back. I'll just use a steel garbage can like the old days....
customer_reviews.author: Jokerizwild

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I've had stand alone one for awhile and works great. Thought it would be good idea to save space and stack them. Top one (in stack of 2) is way too heavy to be supported by bottom one. Bottom one folding in on itself. One of the rims has even cracked. This is after 6 months of use. They should last much longer than this.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth foster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cat food, and advertised as "ant proof"
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my cat food! I normally buy 17lb bags. I have issues with ants in the summer, so we shall see if it really is ant-proof. If not, I'll update my review. I also bought the larger 60lb container for Koi food, and I have them stacked. They both work out great so far. Stackable. UPDATE (9/18/2017): Yup, no ants this year! These are definitely ant-proof.
customer_reviews.author: DNFFTop Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Good until it brakes...
customer_reviews.text: The plastic ring, where the lid goes broke with regular use. And now is not seal tight.
customer_reviews.author: Luis G. Pagan Marmol

customer_reviews.title: Nonexistent customer support
customer_reviews.text: My vittles vault has worked great at keeping bugs from being attracted to my cats food. The only problem is that it has developed a hairline fracture along the seal edge. The product is not over a year old so it should be under the manufacturer warranty. I have attempted calling the manufacturer only to be redirected to an email address that have not received a single response from my three messages sent over the course of the past month and a half. If it weren't for the terrible customer support I would rate this thing a 4 but since the company won't stand behind their warranty I won't give it higher than a 2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DELIBERATELY FRUSTRATING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the large one. This has a label covering two whole sides. It is attached with serious glue, not the kind that will allow you to remove the label. The manufacturer has deliberately made the product so that you will have to spend at least 45 minutes using GoofOff to clean it up. The large one has labels that are removed immediately. I need the product or else I would return both of them. This business does not care about its customers once they get the money. Do not patronize them. I never will again.
customer_reviews.author: PhilosopherKing

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap material, containers rim cracked in two places with little usage and is no longer air tight so kibble isn't kept fresh. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Giant sticker is not easily removed; it doesn't come off cleanly at all.
customer_reviews.text: The container itself is good, just as described. However, the company doesn't care enough about the consumer to use a removeable label on their product, so the sticker plasters half of the item. Twenty minutes of effort in, much residue remains. I will have to soak it overnight. If this kind of thing bothers you, be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Girl

customer_reviews.title: Pest Proof, Naah
customer_reviews.text: Mostly a good container, I store dog food, cat food and bird seed. The label is a bit misleading in that it says "Certified Pest Proof". Well, that may be true for small bugs, but not for rodents. Two of my containers have been breached by mice.
customer_reviews.author: DMiller

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT keep out animals/rodents!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep the squirrels out of my bird feed - it did not work. Within two days, the squirrels went on the attack (first picture). I put done-sided tape around the edge to help deter but did not work. By day 4, the squirrels destroyed it (second picture). The advertisement to this container is that no smell meant that it would not attract rodents. Clearly, this is not the case. I only bought this to help keep the wildlife out of the feed - not only do I have a horrible mess to clean up, but I am out $30. Do NOT buy if you want to keep rodents out!
customer_reviews.author: metallicfox88

customer_reviews.title: Too much hassle
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't seem to be product issue, but a shipping/warehouse issue (maybe because of the holidays?) This was a replacement for one I received two days ago without a lid. Today the replacement came with a lid, but broken top (see pic). I don't need the top/scoop, but it does not reflect well on the product if there are so many issue with this item.
customer_reviews.author: A. Springer

customer_reviews.title: Not stable when stacked
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write a not positive review, unless a product really frustrates me. These fall into that category. I am surprised that these in general have an over 4 star review. I purchased two of the 40 pound capacity bins with the intention of stacking them as that is what they are intended. I filled each to near capacity, and the stability of them is very poor when stacked. So much so, I worry that the slightest bump and they will topple. When stacked, they lean forward, toward the front, in the direction of the opening. I would have assumed that filling near capacity with 40 pounds the stability would be solid, it is not.
customer_reviews.author: packeroni

customer_reviews.title: Warning - Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: These looked great for storing my dog and cat food. Boy was I ever wrong. When you stack one on top of the other the only thing that holds it there is the weight of the top container and they are wobbly. When stacked, the lid on the bottom container will not close tight. Yes, I swapped the containers around and low and behold when on top it closes like a charm and the one that was on top doesn't close now that it is on the bottom. I am soooo disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rubber ring loose upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: So I guess I am just unlucky because the rubber ring around the lid is loose and comes off every time I open or try to put the lid back on the product. The food is already in the bin. So I do not want to empty it (into what?) to return the product. I contacted the manufacture for help, to get a lid with a working (tightly fit) rubber ring, but no response. It was loose from the very beginning and fell off the lid when I opened the bin for the first time upon arrival. Unfortunate this turned out to be total junk and manufacturer is also junk.
customer_reviews.author: Chi

customer_reviews.title: Defective Item
customer_reviews.text: i initially bought this Food storage container for my large quantity of dog food. It arrived on Wednesday Feb 7, 2018. Well, this item arrived warped and distorted from the pressure during shipping. There was a special card that was suppose to normalize pressure to prevent any distortion of this item but due to the lack of attention to detail this card was not inserted correctly therefore with a wobbly item. Wow. ..ill either request for an exchange or refund. Such an inconvenience of my precious time.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. D.

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold 40# of food
customer_reviews.text: Well, I was so hopeful. I needed a container to store an open bag of dog food so that it wouldn't get stale. This product claimed to hold a 40# of food so I assumed my 35# bag would fit easy.... no. I was only able to get about 32# of dog food in the container. Sure, 2# is not much, but the point of a big container is so I don't have to put leftover into other separate containers. I returned this promptly and was unable to determine if it was actually air tight or kept food fresh.
customer_reviews.author: splashgll

customer_reviews.title: Can't trust it.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product two chances, but I was let down both times. I ordered the 25 Lb container and it arrived with two seam cracks on top of the rim. The lid hadn't been screwed on too tight as it was easy to open. I ordered a replacement and had the same problem. If I got one without cracks I worry how long it would take before it cracked too.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: 13 days to failure
customer_reviews.text: I received this March 10. Today is March 23. I put dog food in it, and my dog gets fed twice a day. It's kept inside the house, temperature controlled and not in the elements. In 13 days the seal popped off the life and was in the food when I opened it, with a crack in the seal. I don't crank this thing down hard when I close it. Listen to the reviews, I wish I had. Without a functioning seal this is no better than the bag the dog food came in. Normally I'd give a higher rating even based on the container, but in less than two weeks a major component failed. Don't buy from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Not stackable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a single container for dog food for a few years and haven’t had any issues. Ordered a few more for chickens feed and planned to stack them. When stacked empty they slide around and aren’t “square” so the topple over easily. Thought they would be better after I filled them-nope! Stacked 2 high, they are so unstable I cannot risk them falling onto my kid or a chicken! Also, once filled, the bottom container lid won’t open because the weight of the upper container crushes the lower. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: cicar

customer_reviews.title: Warning!!!  Do NOT Stack or you will be very, very sad!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of these storage containers, 2 40lb and 3 60lb. I tried stacking the 40lb containers but the bottom one collapsed even though it only had 25lbs of feed. I returned for replacement thinking maybe it was just a defective container. I then stacked a 40lb on top of a 60lb and within hours the 60lb had collapsed. Now the lid does not fit securely and it is just plain difficult to get opened and closed. I was so excited about these but now I am just bummed. I am keeping them but building a shelf for the top ones so I do not have to stack.
customer_reviews.author: Misty D. Herring

customer_reviews.title: Lid is warped
customer_reviews.text: I have admired my daughter’s Gamma 2 Vittle Vault for some time. When I finally ordered one, I was thrilled at its arrival until I could not remove the lid. My daughter’s spins on and off easily. My husband gave me a hand and when he got it off, we could see the lid was warped. We tried to thread the lid back on to the bin correctly, but after considerable effort, it still remains out of kilter. I don’t think it will ever be air tight or water proof, not to mention the unwieldy fact that it would also take a football player to wrestle it on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Lady the Rook

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea, doesn’t pay off
customer_reviews.text: They don’t stack well, if you look at it wrong the top one falls off, and the plastic is soft enough, critters go right through it. I got rid of them. Plus the plastic stink never disappeared. I bought a metal bucket with lid and locking handle fits 30 pounds of dog food, now that’s perfect and it looks nice too, no critter is getting into it. Even though you save money with larger amounts, I prefer to buy 30 at a time and keep it fresh.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Wrong capacity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this container for a 28.4 pound bag of dog food. However, all the food did not fit into the container! There was more than 5 pounds of food that did not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Not Stackable!
customer_reviews.text: Not stackable. The container on the bottom could not take the weight of the container stacked on top. These have a 40 pound capacity, and the dog food I poured into each container was only 28 pounds. Both work well standing alone. When stacked, the bottom container will not close. It seems like the weight from the top container causes the bottom one to slightly warp around the opening, making it impossible to screw the lid on correctly. This creates a gaping seal which will not keep the food fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Patrcia

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food storage but a little clumsy and heavy for older person
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars but actually it is 4.5 stars. The container itself is very sturdy, strong, and airtight. It is easy to open and close. The 0.5 star deduction was the measuring cup inside. It is made of flimsy lightweight plastic and was placed inside the container during shipment. After being tossed around in an empty container, the cup was slightly flattened on one side and I could not reshape it back. It will eventually have to be tossed. I don't see the cup lasting more than a few months and I feed my dog only once a day. But, overall, I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deb M, Mililani

customer_reviews.title: The Smell
customer_reviews.text: With the horrible smell I question if it's truly Food Safe, I would want to see actual proof. We ordered two 15 pound vault containers along with the Vittles Vault Jr. All have the same smell. The Scoop for the Jr is much better quality than than ones that come with the bigger vaults. If the smell goes away these should be good for different animal food. If the smell doesn't go away the company with welcome back 3 Vittle Vaults and I'll go back to the original animal food vault company for our containers. Update, I scrubbed the vaults out and let them air out for a couple days and the smell was basically gone.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: "Stackable" is questionable
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these stacked. They don't really lock into each other so it remains possible to knock one off the other, though if you're aware of it it's not hard to avoid. The bigger problem is that the shape of the bottom changes slightly when the top one is full (even if both are full). The opening is compressed and it makes it difficult to line up the lid with the threads precisely where it needs to be, really frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: xryanxbrutalityx

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I have an older style Vittle Vault that I purchased about 3-4 years ago. The difference in quality is astonishing. The new one I purchased has a broken/deformed scooper (with no shards to be found inside the container) and the outer lip is so far away from the container it doesn't even appear airtight. I took photos to compare my older model to this newer one (not sure if my phone will let me post them). I'm not sure if the quality has just diminished or if this is somehow a counterfeit product. Not happy with this product, will not recommend, and will NOT buy again. I'll stick with my older model.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Rocco

customer_reviews.title: NOT Stackable.
customer_reviews.text: NOT STACKABLE! Put dog food in these last night and stacked them. Less than 24hr and the bottom one is already caved in and I almost couldn't get it open. I've have vittle storage containers in the past and none were this flimsy. As soon as new food containers come in, these are going right back! Don't waste your time or money dealing with these.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Food Safe and Fresh
customer_reviews.text: My cats eat expensive prescription cat food for their medical conditions. The food comes in paper bags which once opened expose the food to air, humidity and insects. I fill Vittles Vault Jr.s with the foods, keep them close to the food dishes and re-fill the dishes as needed. The food is fresh and safe from insects. I can easily lift a full Vittles Vault Jr. to pour from it. There is no need to scoop from a paper bag or keep messy paper bags of pet food stored. I highly recommend replacing paper bags of pet food with either a Vittles Vault Jr. or keeping the food in the larger Vittles Vault--especially useful for big bags of dog food.
customer_reviews.author: waterviewgal

customer_reviews.title: Great, but they changed the design! :(
customer_reviews.text: A 5 star review is now 1. We had two of these and needed another. Decided to get the same 60lb size so that would stack. This, despite not really needing that size for the 3rd one. But, was worth it so they would stack on each other. Sadly they changed the design so that the new one will not stack on top of the old ones. VERY disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Tight seal. Holds about 2 lbs less of dry dog kibble than stated
customer_reviews.text: Licks the food super tight. Easy to clean. It doesn’t hold as much as you would think. The 15lb container doesn’t hold a whole 15 lbs of regular sizes kibble. Buy one size up. The size up from this doesn’t hold a full 25 lb bag. I have to feed the pups for a week or so before I put the rest in. I would say it holds at least a couple lbs less than it states ( of dry dog kibble food ). Once you know this and account for that , it’s amazing and the tightest seal you can get. The price is crazy cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT stack these!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 of these to store pet food and bird seed in. We loved that they were "stackable" since we were short on garage space. We stacked them 3 high and filled them with dog food and seed. The middle one warped and had the top container ready to slide off into our car. The lids cannot go back on since they are warped out of round. We paid almost $100 for these and cannot be more disappointed! We could have found something less expensive that worked better. Return date was up 17 days ago! Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Sammieswalt

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware:  Do NOT use these outside!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for my chicken coop to store chicken feed, Corn meal and other chicken foods. All three of them are ruined within a few months by some animal chewing on them to get at what was inside. These would work fine for indoors, but for the money, I thought these would be tough enough to use outside and last. What a waste of $100+ !!
customer_reviews.author: D. Zander

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The container I was sent is defective. Every time I close it, it gets cross-threaded and therefore doesn’t seal properly. The threads on the container broke because the portion around the opening isn’t manufactured properly; one side is glued down and the other is just totally loose. So since the opening isn’t perfectly round , like the lid, it won’t seal and my food is now no good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: NOT AIRTIGHT, ants climb along the threads of the screw on container just fine
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT airtight as they have openings between the threads of the screw on top large enough to allow ants to pass through. We bought them to protect pet food as well as bulk purchases of human food (the only sugar we could find early in the pandemic was a 25 pound bag, for instance) so it has been a not fun surprise to open them and find ants all over the food. They also don't stack particularly securely. They're a lovely idea, but claim much more than they deliver.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: Great for storing bread flour
customer_reviews.text: If you buy 25 or 50 lb bags for bread flour, these are great for storage. 25 lb bag of Costco bread flour fits with room to spare, 50 lb bag will almost all fit (had about 3 lbs extra that I moved to kitchen storage). They seal tight and keep the flour fresh. I use a plastic heavy duty trash liner in this to keep the flour from touching the plastic case.
customer_reviews.author: USMC-Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not pest-proof
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to store bird seed on a covered porch. Attached picture shows one of the squirrels that chewed through the lid in less than 24 hours. The container was sealed tightly, so I can only assume it was not air tight as claimed. Definitely not pest proof. Found ants in the seed as well, but can't be sure they didn't get in after the squirrels chewed a third of the lid off.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca  Furmanick

customer_reviews.title: Solid seal, outgassing smell, doesn't quite fit 34lb large kibble
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening, the container, lid, and scoop had very strong outgassing. After cleaning it and letting it sit open overnight for 2 nights the smell dissipated. It doesn't fit a 34lb bag of Purina Pro Large Breed Puppy, but it's close. However, our food obsessed corgi left it alone after not being able to get into it. It sits out where he can get to it and he mostly ignores it. This means the seal is *very* good because he is crazy about his food and can smell it anywhere. Very happy in that aspect and would just recommend sizing up for large kibble and be prepared to let it sit out a couple nights before use
customer_reviews.author: S. Bransley

customer_reviews.title: Vault is an ambitious word
customer_reviews.text: It's not indestructible. It's quite destructible. It hardly sealed without manhandling in the first place. When it did, the puppy opened it and ate the lid. Now it doesn't seal at all. And neither does my puppy, who made himself sick eating all the food. It's not a vault. It's a buffet with a lid. A puzzle toy for dogs. Maybe these used to be higher quality. Disappointing waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: NicN

customer_reviews.title: NOT AIRTIGHT
customer_reviews.text: This product is not airtight as advertised. Upon receiving the product I washed it out to prepare for use. When washing, I left some water in and closed the lid to test to see if it was airtight. Upon turning the product over the water would continue to come out. The lid design on this product is very poor. I would like to return this product for a refund. I would not recommend this product for storing pet food.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Biernat

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold 40 lbs of dog food
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely does not hold even 35 lbs of purina one. Just bought a 36 lb bag of food for my staffordshire terrier. I probably used somewhere around 3 lbs of food before this container was delivered. Once it was delivered I proceeded to put the rest of the bag into the “40” lb container and had approx 4 lbs left over that would not fit into the container. Probably a good way to store food, but now I need to buy smaller bags because the way this is described is just not what the product presented itself to be. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alan L

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Quality materials, sturdy, good seal, worth the price. I bought two of these for storing malted barley for beer brewing. They are the right size for standard 50-55lb bags. The plastic used in these bins is good quality, and the bin is quite solid. The lid screws on for a tight seal as well. I’ve had both in my carport for around a month now and the ants, weevils, and mice haven’t gotten into, or even seemed to notice, them. I was hesitant to pay $40 +/- for them, but they are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Haff

customer_reviews.title: HA I WIN!
customer_reviews.text: Are use this to store a big bag of cat food for my cat. He's always been notorious for chewing open bags, chewing up in Ziploc bags & popping open the tops of plastic containers. Finally I've discovered something he can't open ! The seal is really tight and keep his cat food fresh so it doesn't get dried out like it normally would sitting in a Ziploc bag. I definitely recommend this product for storing pet food 😁
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Don't be like me, check the size of the bags of food
customer_reviews.text: I bought and returned this item as it was "way too small". Somehow I thought my bags of game-bird feed were 25#, but they are 50#, that's why they did not fit there. Now the box: airtight, well built. Likely not resistant to rodents, raccoons... but for inside storage, that's good IMO. Rodent-proof: need metal like large metal garbage cans, but they can be challenging to get air and water-proof. I bought a larger version of this I will review. The larger one just barely fits my 50# bag, but is the right size for me. Both are builtthe same way. Also I had some "Gamma-lid" from the same company, so they have been doing air-tight buckets lids for years.
customer_reviews.author: T.Perraut

customer_reviews.title: NOT stackable and terrible lids
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these hold a lot of food; I purchased 3 of them to hold dog food and chicken feed. I stacked 2 of them with 60 lbs. of dog food on the bottom bin, and 40 lbs. of chicken feed on the top bin. The next day, the bottom bin had collapsed. The lid threads are slightly off, so when you try to seal the lid, often it takes two hands to line up the threads to close it. There are better and cheaper options out there, and I do not recommend these. Cheaply made, and expensive.
customer_reviews.author: chiquitita230

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats, dogs and other small animals
customer_reviews.text: I used vittles vault for years and years. I used their larger containers for horse feed when I had a horse back in the day. Also for our two dogs food but they passed in 2015 and 2017. Now im using this smaller one for my cats food and it's size is perfect for her dry Food. This smaller size works well in our laundry room. I also liked the fact it was half the price of the ones in the pet stores so that was nice! I will definitely keep buying vittles vault products as long as I have animals!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We have a similar, larger container for dog food, and my 16-month-old was obsessed with it, so we got this one to store his megablocks. Immediately, the round rubber band that goes around the lid just fell off. Its too big for the container and doesn't fit on it properly. I thought, annoying, but I'll just keep putting it back on when it comes off. The lid just never screwed on easily though, like our other container, and now, it won't screw on at all. I regret not sending it back in the first place. DON'T BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Neil Moore

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and sag over time making them unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Beware - These sag over time and are unusable. Company refused to replace, although I would not have wanted new ones unless they improved design. Don't waste your money and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: I had some food that eneded up molding after a month in one. I figured it must have been the food, so i got another to stack them. One held 40lbs of food the other 30lbs of litter. When i put the heavier one on top it didnt feel very secure and could easily slip off and the opening of the bottom one started to get mishapened after one night . making it hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: roy hasaface

customer_reviews.title: Order 10lbs more than what you need
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 35lb container for the 35lb bag of dog food I buy. I normally don't do this when buying food containers, I usually get ones that are at least 10 lbs bigger. But, when reading the question and answers on here people kept saying these containers were pretty accurate to the bag of food you buy. They are dead wrong!! The 35lb container I got probably only fit 2/3's of my 35lb bag of dog food...
customer_reviews.author: Scott M. Ladd II

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent dog food storage container; no issues, air-tight
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for three months now. It is far & away the best dog food storage container we've had. I read some reviews when I purchased this about it not being air-tight, but I have not had that issue. When you put the lid on securely, and with just a moderate bit of pressure (nothing excessive), it is air-tight and bug-proof. I live in the country, and believe me, if it wasn't secure, the bugs would let me know quickly :). I also love the size, I can store an entire 40LB bag of dog food at one time, which means no open bags half-full being stored. I don't write many reviews, but felt this product deserved one.
customer_reviews.author: stuart feldman

customer_reviews.title: no customer service others great
customer_reviews.text: the price went down $12 right after mine was delivered, seems to be no way to contact the seller :( ... my only problem with these is that the o ring seal on the lids stretches over time, we had 4 of these had to get rid of because couldn't get a replacement o-ring doesn't seem to be a way to get ahold of customer service - still going to get 2 more to replace our 2 remaining ones that are wearing out now they are about 3 years old .. but these are still the best, tried the Iris ones but they just not a good as these
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer N

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED to Less Stars ----- Nice System for Multiple Pets
customer_reviews.text: 7/11 Updated Review We've had the system for nearly two months and can no longer stack. If/when middle container is too heavy (approx half way full) it puts so much pressure on bottom container and you cannot twist the lid back in place without unstacking first. Keeping system because Amazon charges you to return it. However, it takes up much more space now because they have to sit independently and can't be one stack. ---------------------------------- 5/18 Original Review Bought for two dogs and one cat. Stack well, but are unstable when barely full. Entire stack shakes when opening/closing. Holds food well. Scoop that comes with is entirely too large and we don’t use. Overall happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: hbinoc

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I love many things about this container but some things not. It is very difficult to move, it could use a handle of some sort. I purchased this container as I was glad to see that it was advertised that it was airtight thus keeping my birdseed fresh. I did not get the chance to find out if this claim was true as the squirrels found their way into the container by chewing through the lid. Although the company made no claim as to this container being critter proof, I mistakenly assumed that due to the design it would be. Well anyway I am looking to purchase a replacement lid if any one could help. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: NOT RODENT PROOF; NOT PEST PROOF
customer_reviews.text: I have been storing my dog's food in this container and up until past month it has kept out the pests and rodents. However, there are now 3 holes that has been gnawed through in the bottom of container. Since I bought this item in September 2018 I don't know if I can get a refund or replacement. I am rather disappointed since the reason for my purchase was to keep pests and rodents out.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Ban seal fell off lid - immediately replaced!
customer_reviews.text: Update to my review. I requested a replacement through Amazon and they sent me a replacement immediately. Great and fast customer service. The new lid seal doesn’t look that much more secure and maybe it is working from just securing the lid close. In any case it works and we are happy with it, and giving 5 star. ————- original review ———- Rubber seal on lid fell off. Is this suppose to be sealed to the lid? This appears to be a faulty airtight. Aside from that, holds a lot, easy to move and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Pros-only take a square foot of space and is very compact, cute design with the little paw prints Cons-measuring cup was terribly warped and got tossed out because it's not recyclable, does not hold a 25.3 pound bag of canine Royal Canin Urinary S/O. I wound up with about 10 cups that wouldn't fit, despite rattling cube from side to side to fill every void. As with anything that has a screw on lid, be mindful that the threads seat properly. It can be a little difficult to get the top started. I can't really comment on the freshness or airtightness. This amount of food lasts my dog about two months, so hopefully it will live up to its claims.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and quality, but there is a problem with the strong smell of uncured plastic inside.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give the item five stars. It is nice size, seems sturdy and is stackable. The only concern that I have is that the inside of the container has a strong toxic smell of plastic, even after leaving it open and washing it. Smells like uncured plastic.I don't like anything toxic in my pet's food and the food seems to pick up the smell. We all know how dangerous some plastics are and too many cause cancer. I lost my last pet to cancer, so I will leave it open for a few more days to see if the smell goes away.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. B.

customer_reviews.title: Not stackable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for different dog foods I have. They are not stackable. As you can see in the video they have no stability on top of each other. It does seem air tight but the material is so thin my big girl would probably chew right through it like one of her chew toys.
customer_reviews.author: Stinky

customer_reviews.title: Favorite way to store dry dog food
customer_reviews.text: I love Vittles Vaults for storing dog kibble in. This design is much easier to wash and dry between refills than their slanted/stackable design. I do wish they had a better way to gauge the size of the canister you need. I ordered the container that clearly stated it would hold 35 lbs of dog food, but it barely holds the 26 lb of kibble I poured in last night with just enough room to squeeze the scoop back in before tightening the lid. The scoop is a bit flimsy, especially the handle, but I typically use a stainless steel measuring cup for easier washing, so that is not as important to me.
customer_reviews.author: C Fritsche

customer_reviews.title: This thing STINKS! (for real, it has a horrible plastic odor.)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to store my cat food in. Cats are very sensitive to odors and there is no way I can put my cat food in this storage container. I have a lot of plastic storage stuff and I was really not expecting the very strong odor that greeted me when I opened this. I tried washing it out and letting it air out but that has done nothing to get rid of the plastic smell that is strong enough to make my nose run and my eyes burn when I first opened the lid. No thank you.
customer_reviews.author: JaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size.
customer_reviews.text: Holds a 15 lb bag of large size kibble easily. It fits neatly in a 18'' cabinet with room to spare. The seal holds in that lovely smell so it doesn't fill the room. I plan to buy another small one for treats. My only dislike and it's a small one is the top is hard to thread one handed. I like to be able to hold a bowl in one hand while opening it. It would be nice if there was a way to hang a cup from it as well, but that's just nit picky. Highly recommend this, I saw it at everyone's favorite pet supply store for twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: RollinggirlTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-use Container
customer_reviews.text: I know these containers are primarily designed for pet food storage, but as a caregiver, I use these containers to store baking soda and magnesium salts for use in therapeutic baths. These keep the ingredients dry and easily stored and accessible. I was so tired of dealing with the bags that the original products came in with poor closures and easily spilled bags. These containers with their large openings make preparation of baths really easy. I am so pleased with both the design and sturdiness of these containers.
customer_reviews.author: Steelhead

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and have stood the test of time!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 5 of these containers over the past 4 years - we have a few pets that each require different dry foods. Dog has liver abnormality from being kicked in the side as a puppy. One cat has major environmental and food allergies while the other needs sensitive digestion food, and our Ferret has had digestive issues her whole life. These containers are really sturdy with airtight covers that keep their food nice and fresh and hold a whole 5 lb bag of food in each. So glad my daughter found these! Best storage containers we have ever found.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria B.

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the negative reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Since this item had so many great reviews, I went ahead and purchased the 25 lb vault. A quick look When received, I didn't initially notice anything wrong. But after washing the vault I noticed a crack (see photo) near the opening of the vault, as so many other negative reviewers before me had mentioned. Still usable, hence one star. However I paid for a new, undamaged product. Too much of a hassle to return the item since I threw away the old box and packaging already.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie

customer_reviews.title: Food Storage
customer_reviews.text: I know that these are typically used for pet foods, but consider that they are air tight plastic. I am using them to store staples, rice, beans, grits, flours and dehydrated veggies that I am doing myself. Summer is coming and I will dehydrate the excess veggies and store them in these. I love the way these containers are made. they stack well in a corner and hold a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Tight Fitting Lid
customer_reviews.text: This is not only more compact than the 15 pound bag or other containers, this keeps the food fresh and no little pests get in! I buy large bags for my little dog because it’s cheaper. A 15 pound bag lasts 3 months. I was having an ant problem around her food so I needed something. This keeps the ants out! I live in an apartment without much storage. I was hesitant it would hold 15 pounds when I first saw it. But it does with room to spare! I also keep it out in the open. It looks nice and the size is discreet. I couldn’t be happier! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Overall great container, but difficult to fill/move
customer_reviews.text: We use this container to store our food-crazy lab puppy's kibble, and overall we like it. My only complaints are that it is difficult to move when full, and more difficult to fill due to its shape. Holding a 40lb bag of food over the opening to dump it all in is extra challenging since the container can only be filled if it is in a different position than how it's normally sitting. Requires a bit of finness to pull it off. As for freshness of the food stored, I can only assume it is of the freshest quality (our lab never complains, and I refuse to try it to see). It is definitely puppy-proof so far, which we appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Mememe

customer_reviews.title: My 5th VV
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love vittles vaults. This is my 5th one, and I've had no real issues with them (one had an annoying top, but still worked just fine). I have 4 for animal food, including one kept outside on a covered porch, and I use one for dry rice. They keep out all bugs, and I haven't had any food spoil in them. I bought this 4+ lb one to store a 5lb bag of Wysong ferret food for my ferret. It is working out wonderfully, just like the others. Nice and small too, so it fits sideways on the bottom shelf of a critter nation cage. A+ product!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly airtight but way smaller than described.
customer_reviews.text: I got these are some weevils infiltrated my previous dog food Rubbermaid containers and I realized I needed to spend a little more if I never wanted to have to de-weevil my house again. I'm torn in this review-- for airtightness and qualify of the product, this container gets five stars. It absolutely doesn't hold a 25 lb bag of dogfood--not even close. My 17lb bag of dogfood filled it up and overflowed it a little. Do yourself a favor and size up to the 40 lb container. The 40 lb container holds a 25 lb bag of food with some room.
customer_reviews.author: ImLisaAnn

customer_reviews.title: Two months old and cracked.
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this since the end of September this year. We use it for cat food and it lives in the house in the pantry on the ground. There is already a huge crack along the top just from the stress of the spinning lid locking and unlocking. Super disappointed, glad we don’t have this outside or somewhere it needs to be water tight anymore. These aren’t cheap to break so soon! Hoping our other three don’t have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Cannot stack, not air-tight
customer_reviews.text: So we bought a number of these and they are okay, but are not as advertised. If you are stacking them with any amount of stuff inside they will deform. They just are not designed to hold the weight of even one other one stacked above it. Definitely not 3-high as we were hoping to do. They are also not airtight. They seal decently well, but you can push on one and expel air out of the top. So don't get them for being airtight. So...they are decent, but not really as advertised. We bought 6 for various dry food goods and wish we had gone with something else.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect .
customer_reviews.text: I love this bin. It's very sturdy and well made. Like that it came with a scoop that lets you get the food out of the bin without it falling all over the floor. Tight seal and easy on the hands to open. Mice were chewing through our dog food bags, even the heavy ones, so this has been a great purchase. No more mice. It's also compact. I'll likely also buy the bigger container as my dogs diets are different & I buy 50 lbs at a time of the other food.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Girl

customer_reviews.title: Protection from pests
customer_reviews.text: I bought this container to protect the dog food from ants and preserve the freshness. I can't say much about the ability to preserve freshness and how airtight it is because I haven't had it long enough. I find it a bit difficult to open the screw lid. The description said it will fit 40 lbs of dog food. I just got a 40 lbs bag and guess what? A lot of the kibbles didn't fit in the container. I understand that the 40 lbs are just an estimation but I was surprised that 1/5 to 2/5 of the bag didn't fit. The dog food brand is Purina One Healthy Weight Formula.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGoLucky

customer_reviews.title: Handy bins for prepping
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to start my stockpile of baking and dry pantry items like Dry beans , rice ect during the COVID stay at home time . I was able to store a ton of extra Dry foods that helped us from having to keep running to the store . I’m going to buy a couple more and expand my Storage for Winter since these are in my basement they lock our Both moisture and mice Which is important.
customer_reviews.author: K.Grill

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT STACK
customer_reviews.text: These bins are not stackable. Not 1 bit. They wobble all over, and if you put anything close to the weights it can handle, they crush the bottom one. Also mine came missing the feed scoops too. Honestly waste of money if looking for compact storage.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great pet food container
customer_reviews.text: I really like this container. It's made of hard plastic and so far has held up nicely. We don't screw on the lid most of the time, or sometimes just barely. It can be a little difficult to get straight on before screwing it down. If you get it at a wonky angle, I can see it breaking the plastic around the lip like in some of the reviews on here. But overall it's good quality and feels sturdy. Ours is sitting below a window, so we will see how it holds up to continuous UV exposure.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical odor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these food storage containers for my cat and dog. They have very strong chemical odor. I washed them thoroughly, air dried them and they've been sitting empty with lids off in the room for a month now; hoping the odor will eventually disappear, no luck yet. Can't use them to store my fur babies food. Another Chinese junk product, yet pricey.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Not Raccoon or Squirrel proof!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a little more than a week. No match for the squirrels! This is my second one that's gone bad so far. The first lost it's air tightness after being attacked by a raccoon. After a hard rain the container filled with water and ruined the kibble inside. The second was chewed through by a squirrel. It would be nice if I could just purchase a replacement lid and gasket but all the options I've seen cost more than the actual container.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Under 22LBs of storage
customer_reviews.text: This pet food storage is suppose to hold up to 25lbs as you can see from the pictures it only held up to 22LBs of cat food. It’s is also much bigger then the Remington 28quart pet food storage I have beside it. Much wider. I’m disappointed it couldn’t hold the entire 22lb bag of food. The plastic is heavy duty the design is very cute the cup it comes with is very light weight. Over all is a good buy for under 22LBs of pet food. It also had a odor when you first open the bin. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Have Loved these for Years!
customer_reviews.text: We have always had a house full of critters horses, dogs, cats and goats and have used these to store thier food. Some we have had for close to 15 years or better. These things are very sturdy and secure. We were recently invaded by ants got into the pantry ruining the sugars, flours and most of the baking ingredients. So I took a bigger one that I had and put all the baking stuff in it & used this one for pet treats. We did get an exterminater, but the ant thing happens ever spring.
customer_reviews.author: LisaLu

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Not Racoon Proof
customer_reviews.text: We have some feral cats that we have been trapping, fixing and releasing for several years. Some racoons moved onto our property and were getting into the cat food. I tried various cans and containers and nothing has kept them out. Last month I bought a 60lb Vittles Vault Airtight Stackable Pet Food Container. It took the racoons less than a week to figure out how to open it. One racoon holds the container while another unscrews the lid. I have tried screwing the lid shut as tight as I can (so tight that my wife cannot open it) but every morning the lid is off and the racoons are getting fat.
customer_reviews.author: Neal A. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Pet food storage container
customer_reviews.text: This is our second pet food storage container like this. We use one to store bird seed ( for our bird feeders) and the newest one to store dry dog food for our Boxer. The only reason I gave it a “3” on maneuverability is because when its full (50-60# of dog food) my wife can’t move it. My recommendation is to put it where you want it, fill it and leave it there. Ours is inside the house but I guess it could be used outside, I’d recommend this container for any kind of dry pet food storage.
customer_reviews.author: gamenut

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life easier
customer_reviews.text: I love this container! It is so much easier to reach into this than the big bag that dog food comes in. Our bag of food is 38pounds and fits perfectly in this container. I have noticed it also stays fresher longer. It also fits perfectly in my closet. You can lay it in 2 directions depending on taller or deeper cabinet space. The only negative I noticed, was when it first arrived, the inside had a strong plastic-y smell. I left it open to air out for a day before putting the dog food inside and it was fine. I definitely recommend this container!
customer_reviews.author: Allison D

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy containers for food.
customer_reviews.text: My mom wanted these containers for rice. Yes, rice. This was the 3rd one I purchased for her. She also has the 50 pound container. TWO OF THEM. That's how much she loves it. There was a "factory" smell to it but she washed it and it was fine after. The 50 pound one is really big and didn't fit in the pantry well but the 30 pound (this one) is just the right size. It says that it protects against ants since it's airtight.
customer_reviews.author: Phanessa

customer_reviews.title: 40 lb container will not hold 40 lbs of dog food
customer_reviews.text: Just got the 40 pound container today, seems like a good product but does not hold a 37.5 lb bag of dog food. I have a bag that I’ve been using for a couple days, when I got the container today I poured in the dog food and filled it up but it wasn’t able to hold the full bag. Very annoying, if it’s rated for 40 pounds it should hold a 37.5 pound bag without issue. It is also. It easy to move around since it doesn’t have any handles
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good solid container
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten one of these about 2 years ago for our one dog. When we got a second dog who is on different food from our other dog, we got a second one. I was disappointed because the lid glides so easily on our first one. This one is a bit more challenging. We have to fiddle with it every time to get it to close, which is frustrating for our dog as he is only 7 months old and waiting impatiently to be fed. That said, this is a great product and still do recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: nickles

customer_reviews.title: Does not even come close to 40lbs
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 40lb, thinking it would my 31.1 lb bag of dog food no problem. This didn't even fit the 31.1 lb bag of Purina dry dog food. It came close, but there was about 2-3lbs that didn't fit. There is no way you would fit 40lbs of dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly

customer_reviews.title: Air tight seal, lock any insects out!
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice find for my dog. For the price point this is definitely a good investment. It comes with a scooper and I was happy that I didn’t have to purchase one for it. It was packaged nicely, no damage. It opens easily, and is air right so I don’t have to worry about insects or ants!!! trying to get inside my dogs food. There’s small grooves on the sides that act as inner handles so that helps with transport. Hopefully this stands the test of time I will update my review after a few more weeks/months of usage. Thanks for reading and I hope you also enjoy your pups container. :)
customer_reviews.author: Brook A.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Kennel Stays
customer_reviews.text: We have two dogs and use one of these for weekend kennel stays and two for longer stays. They are wonderful! They come with lids and keep their food fresh. I also have another two that I use to store bird feed. They are the perfect size for me to carry and pour into the feeder. I'm on here now ordering two more as the $%^&$^%$^ squirrels ate through two of them when I accidentally left outside!!
customer_reviews.author: K Lamel

customer_reviews.title: Designed To Be Stackable, But The Container Buckle When Stacked, Degrading Airtightness
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product over a similar one with the lid on the top because the side lid design allows stackable. But the material was either too thin or not stiff enough that the container buckled when stacked with a moderate weight. Not only the container buckled under the weight, but it also compromised air tightness by deforming the lid rim. I was somewhat disappointed. If they can improve the product by thickening the container material or somehow stiffen structurally, I would definitely award the rest of stars that I am withholding.
customer_reviews.author: Byung m. Na

customer_reviews.title: Big space in a little package
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't believe when I saw the size of this that it would hold 15lbs of dog food, but I emptied my bag in there and it had a little space left at the top. It's also bug-proof and weather-proof. Honestly, this is the best $20 I've ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Joann L

customer_reviews.title: None of them are airtight
customer_reviews.text: I ordered multiple of these units (35 pound), and none of them are watertight. I put water in them to clean them, put the lid on, and the water started leaking from the lid. They also offgass a very bad chemical smell even after washing. If you want to store them outside, the “legs” of the unit are pressed from the thin plastic at the bottom. If you put them on the concrete the plastic will get chewed away leaving holes in the bottom of the unit. Not Vittles Vault best day. At least they’re getting dumped on Amazon at a discount.
customer_reviews.author: 人

customer_reviews.title: The design changed no side handles, thinner material.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these awhile back. Heavy duty, workes great, but my cat’s did figure out how to unscrew the lid. I just ordered/ received a New one for storing Dog food. The design has changed. The grasping handles on the side are no longer there. The Plastic is much thinner. Mine came with a small dent on it. Too bad the USA Company lessened the quality of their product. It went from a 5 Star container to a 1.5 Star container. I won’t be purchasing any more products from this company. I have purchased 7 Quality containers from this Company and now 1 that I’m very disappointed with. Fast Prime shipping though.
customer_reviews.author: stephen s.

product_meta.title: Gamma2 Vittles Vault Outback Stackable Airtight Pet Food Storage Container
product_meta.description:
Size:25 LBThe Vittles Vault Plus 25 is just right for keeping your pet food fresh in that small space with the space efficient square elegantly designed style shape. They are absolutely Airtight to keep your pet food fresh. The easy grip molded handles make it easy to move even when full. Ideal for those mid size bags of pet food. It has a free measuring cup too.

AMAZON.COM


GAMMA2 VITTLES VAULT "PLUS" CONTAINERS
Pets come in all shapes and sizes and so do pet food containers. That's why we created the Vittles Vault Prime line - these containers are designed to be the "Best in Class" and keep your dry pet food fresh and pest free. "Lock-Down" double gaskets and storage efficient shapes make the Vittles Vault Prime the ultimate choice. Premium features and heavy duty construction allow these containers to last for decades--literally!

 * Airtight

 * Heavy Duty

 * Easy Spin On / Off lid

 * Lock-Down Double Gaskets

 * Molded handles for easy grip

 * Decorative Bas-Relief Paw Prints (25lb & 35lb versions)

MADE FROM HIGH DENSITY POLYETHYLENE, FOOD GRADE PLASTIC. BPA FREE.
We care about the safety and storage of food, for people and pets! Vittles Vaults are completely recyclable. Weights are estimates and will vary based on size and density of kibble.

Supplied parts: Container with Screw on/off threaded gasketed lid and a one cup scoup.

Replacement lids and/or gaskets are available online
feature_bullets: Airtight Pet Food Container: This pest-proof pet food container for dry food keeps food fresh with our patented airtight sealing system that locks moisture out. Design is stackable for space efficiency. Includes scoop

Food Storage Container: The pet food pail is made of food-grade, BPA-free HDPE plastic that won't shatter if dropped & can be kept in garages, barns & outdoors. Perfect for dry food, treats, bird seed & horse feed
Airtight Engineering: Our Gamma Seal technology makes for a controlled moisture balance & features a threaded locking system with reliable double gaskets for freshness & controlled moisture

Made In America: GAMMA2, Inc. created & patented an airtight container in 1989 & has always been committed to manufacturing in the USA. Our storage containers provide a solution in pet food staleness&ensures dry pet food stays fresh & protected from pests

GAMMA2: Dog & cat dry food stays fresh & nutritious with our collection of airtight food containers. Features wall mounted containers, travel, pantry & kitchen containers & larger containers for large dogs & horses

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
